definition.content:
Gain comprehensive visibility into your organization's web application security by monitoring F5 DCS Web Application Firewall (WAF) Event logs with this dashboard.

A Web Application Firewall (WAF) is a security solution designed to protect web applications by filtering and monitoring HTTP traffic between a web application and the Internet. F5 DCS Web Application Firewall is a WAF solution that provides comprehensive protection, leveraging sophisticated threat intelligence and customizable security policies to safeguard web applications. The WAF detects signature-based attacks, distinguishes good bots from malicious bots, runs threat campaigns, detects various security violations, detects false positive events, and applies associative preventive actions.

WAF logs provide a comprehensive view of web application security events, including detailed information on attacks, policy actions, and traffic patterns. This data is critical for monitoring, analyzing, and improving web application security, enabling organizations to respond effectively to threats and maintain a secure web environment.

For Further reading, see:

- [F5 Distributed Cloud Services -Web Application Firewall Documentation](https://docs.cloud.f5.com/docs/ves-concepts/security#waf)

Datadog Cloud SIEM analyzes and correlates Alert logs to detect threats to your environment in real time. If you don't see signals please make sure you've enabled [Datadog Cloud SIEM](https:///security).
